column1: While IL - 4 does not activate STAT5, it induces expression of STAT5 - regulated genes in CTLL - 2, i. e. beta - casein, a cytokine - inducible SH2 - containing protein ( CIS), and oncostatin M ( OSM), suggesting that STAT6 activated by IL - 4 substitutes for the function of STAT5 in T cells.

column1: We previously identified a Fas ligand regulatory element ( FLRE) in the Fas ligand ( fasL) promoter that binds Egr family proteins and demonstrated that Egr - 3 ( PILOT) but not Egr - 1 ( NGFI - A, Krox - 24, Tis - 8, and Zif - 268) induces transcription of fasL.
